abstract: NBC selects Lester Holt to fill in for Brian Williams, anchor of NBC Nightly News who was suspended for six months; industry insiders say placement could turn into a full-time job for Holt, since Williams is unlikely to be placed back in anchor's chair, even after his suspension is up; network will be closely following viewer numbers, as show generates some $200 million a year in advertising dollars.
lead_paragraph: Known as an unflappable pro, the newsman tapped to fill the anchor’s chair at “NBC Nightly News” for the next six months is also a strong contender to keep the job.

headline.main: In Lester Holt, NBC Gets Calm After the Brian Williams Storm
headline.print_headline: In Holt, Calm After the Williams Storm
